channel.title: Which Auxy instrument do you think is best?
channel.description:
Hello everyone. Lizard is one of my favorite instruments in auxy and one of the most useful for many different things.
Lizard is just fun to use and play around with in most of my tracks
I was bored and wanted to see what lizard could do so I made https://app.auxy.co/projects/phExM-AK1xWVryGMK0Q8wA== Feel free to add to it.
What is the best sound to you?

item.title: Which Auxy instrument do you think is best?
item.dc:creator: ThoughtfulNoise
item.description:
Noir is the only piano sound I’ve ever used in any Auxy tracks - though I’ve not used piano in that many tracks.

As for my favourite/most used instrument, almost certainly Lobby from Vintage Keys.
It’s my go-to if I’m sketching out some ideas for a new jazzy piece.

It’s become a staple for at least one of the genres/names I create under.

Read full topic

item.description:
Jelly is good since it sounds like a Roland Juno.

I also like Silo and June.

Mist and Rain are good too since they have such a dreamy sound.

item.title: Which Auxy instrument do you think is best?
item.dc:creator: Thrashie
item.description:
id say either punch or lake, considering how punch is an important part of the music I tend to make and lake kinda gives an Asian traditional feel if you know how to utilize it as such. OH and Gossip was a good instrument back when there were no sound packs gave a kind of sliding effect when stuff like that wasn’t possible with other instruments

item.source: Which Auxy instrument do you think is best?

item.title: Which Auxy instrument do you think is best?
item.dc:creator: INDIR3CT
item.description:
Here are my personal favorite instruments that go slightly unnoticed.
1: Plum - A great synth that makes wubs easy. One chord note makes a really cool wub-like sound that doesn’t require any low/high pass, or volume wub auotomations,
2: Pressure - Absolutely the most versatile sound. High octave notes make great leads. Low octave notes make great bass lines. Depending on how you adjust the settings, you can make pressure sound like a sub bass, or a very deep, growly, dubstep like bass! Totally awesome!
3: Secret - Probably one of my favorite synths to use in chords, secret is a unique sounding synth that can be used in many genres.

Read full topic
